did.unittitle: Union League of Philadelphia House Committee records

bioghist.p: The Union League of Philadelphia was founded in 1862 as a patriotic society to support the policies of President Abraham Lincoln. It evolved to its current identity as a non-sectarian and non-partisan private club. The House Committee was established as a Standing Committee at least by 1871 and continues to the present. It has had a wide range of responsibilities including membership services and privileges, activities, employee relations, operations (including restaurant) and building maintenance and contents. It is at times unclear what falls within some of these different areas--membership services may include food and beverage, but food and beverage may also fall within operations. Consequently, the organization of the subseries is somewhat arbitrary. Although the House Committee once had oversight of various parties and other entertainment at the League, this was transferred to the Entertainment Committee in 1979. The Superintendent/General Manager reported to the House Committee for many years.

scopecontent.p: The series has been arranged into six subseries: Minutebooks, General Files, Member Services/Privileges, Employee Relations, Operations, and Building. The Minutebooks subseries contains 15 volumes. The content of the minutes describe personnel actions, purchases, work on the building and treasurer's reports to the House Committee. The General Files subseries includes includes notices and other information on dining, member services, and minutes. There are also a few reports, including a report on a study of the food and beverage operations. The Member Services/Privileges subseries is comprised mainly of member directories, 1863-2008. The directories include basic information on officers and members, including name, address, and year joined. This subseries also includes receipts, forms, notices, and other recordkeeping related to member accounts; guest registers, 1952-2003 (some gaps), listing the name and city, state, and/or country of origin for League guests; and printed materials from other clubs with whom the Union League had reciprocal agreements. The Employee Relations subseries includes four volumes, dated between 1872 and 1936, of employee lists that record dates of service with occasional notes about employees; files and time cards of a random sample of employees (bulk years 1966-1982); miscellaneous announcements; and records and files related to the 25 Year Club, Blood Donor Club and Christmas Fund. The Operations subseries consists primarily of menus and wine lists for the Union League restaurant, and programs, menus, and printed materials for non-Union League-sponsored events held at the League (some items are autographed). The subseries includes a small amount of marketing material, as well as several logbooks related to routine operations such as cash on hand. The Building subseries includes reports, plans, correspondence, and other information related to renovations of the Union League building and strategic planning. The subseries includes member surveys and a focus group report related to the 2003 strategic planning effort.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
